meanings.definition: A large fish of the sea bass family, typically found in warm seas.
meanings.sent1: The grouper swam gracefully through the coral reef.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen caught a big grouper for dinner.
meanings.sent3: Why did the grouper bring a suitcase to the ocean? To have a 'reefreshing' vacation!
meanings.sent4: The grouper ruled the underwater kingdom with its majestic presence.
meanings.sent5: The grouper's scales shimmered like a treasure under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A member of a group of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The grouper of students worked together on the science project.
meanings.sent2: The grouper of trees provided shade in the park.
meanings.sent3: Why did the grouper refuse to play cards with the other groupers? Because they were all 'shuffling' too much!
meanings.sent4: She stood out from the grouper of dancers with her unique moves.
meanings.sent5: The grouper of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
